docs.lead_paragraph: Noam Chomsky stirs furor in France 2 Salvadoran village gets a taste of war 3 Around the World 4 Israel reports downing two Syrian jet fighters 4 Senegal's President resigns after 20 years in office 4 General Around the Nation 5 Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive financier, vanishes in Nassau 5 New Year's wishes by notables in New York City 21 Westchester gets evacuation plan for nuclear emergencies 22 Black man stabbed by a white on street in Buffalo 22 Studio 54's former owners win prison term reduction 23 Officer suspended in killing of un- armed Bronx man 23 NEW YEAR'S DAY Parking - Sunday regulations in effect; alternate-side rules suspended. Sanitation - No collections, no street cleaning. Federal, state and municipal offices -Closed. Post offices - Closed; only special delivery and express mail delivered. Banks - Closed. Stock and commodity markets -Closed. Transportation - Subways and buses on holiday schedule; handicapped and senior-citizen fares in effect; Long Island Railroad and Conrail on holiday schedule; PATH trains and Suburban Bus Authority on Sunday schedule. Libraries - Closed. Public schools - Most closed until Jan. 5.
